page.title: 07HAIG MATERNITY HOSPITAL.
page.content: The Haig Maternity Hospital was opened in l93l and was popular because of the high risks of having babies at home. The nearest hospital before this was in Edinburgh which is 5l miles away. The Haig is still well used today but any difficult births are taken to Edinburgh. We interviewed Matron Crozier and asked her about the running of the Haig. Most babies are born during January, February and March. The quietest months for births are June and July. She told us that there are still slightly more boys born than girls and the most popular names for children used to be Mary and John although there are much more unusual names chosen today. The average age for a mother to give birth in the Haig is between l8 and 22. The oldest lady to give birth was 46.
